most_active_tickets.title: CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS leads to null.pieces.cloud

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and plugins encounter various bugs
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS and its plugins across different operating systems (primarily Windows). These include: 1. File-dragging problems in conversation context. 2. File-choosing window behavior. 3. Filter rule limitations. 4. Automatic redirection to Pieces support on launch. 5. LLM upgrade failures despite Pro subscription.  Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root causes and solutions.

CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
2. the window for file choosing sometimes pops out back (not front)
3. filter rules only applies to certain files, for example, .jsonl is excluded

related_issues.title: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
related_issues.text: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Visual Studio, Sublime Plugin, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows 11 ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have a small problem now that cannot be solved through LLM: - I have inquired with LLM in **pieces for developers** and **pieces vscode plugin**, and they all said they are Sonnet 3.5. - The pieces LLM in sublime (set claude 3.7 sonnet) keeps silence about this: **Copilot**: I'm an AI assistant created by Anthropic named Claude, and my training data has a cutoff date. While I don't typically specify my exact version details, I can tell you that my knowledge cutoff is around late 2023. This means I don't have information about events, technologies, or developments that occurred after that time. However, - I just **upgraded to Pieces Pro yesterday** and have switched to Sonnet 4 (for all pieces IDE plugins and Desktop Apps, except for sublime which only support sonnet 3.7 till now). - Every test chat was opened in a new Chat after the LLM is switched( to Sonnet 4 or Gemini 2.5 Pro)... - I've checked the configuration files and they are all Sonnet 4 without any issues. - I have tried restarting my computer or logging in to my account again, but still have this bug - I have tried changing my computer and VPN node, including canceling or adding the global system proxy, but none of them worked PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. ## Pieces for Deveopers (desktop app) ## Vscode plugin ## Sublime plugin Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Pro Upgrade and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty upgrading to Pieces Pro, with the checkout process failing to complete.  Additionally, some users report connectivity problems between Pieces OS and browser extensions, even with VPNs configured.  Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening
related_issues.text: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hi guys! I want to try a "Pro" plan, however the modal with payment is not opening and the button "Upgrade Now" turns to "Awaiting checkout..." and nothing happens. I've tried through the Desktop App, Pieces OS app - neither helped. Could you please advice? Default Browser: Arc (if it helps) PiecesOs Log Attached [log-08102025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21704376/log-08102025.txt) Pieces for Developers log string: ``` [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_button [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: true [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: PiecesProInformationDialog [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream, PiecesProInformationDialog] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_upgrade_to_pro_button [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: /workstream [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 ``` Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.1.1 Bugs and Feature Requests
common_issues.description: Users report issues with copying inline and inter-line code blocks, dragging files into conversation context, and LLM not upgrading to the latest version (Sonnet 4) despite Pro upgrade.  Additional problems include file choosing window behavior and filter rule limitations. Suggested solutions include fixing copy/paste functionality, enabling file dragging, and ensuring LLM version updates correctly.  A feature request for partial in-line code block copying is also included.

related_issues.title: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
related_issues.text: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !! ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. 1. The 2nd pic below do not function properly: The description of this problem only requires one line equation, and inequality of graphics: - it should be: Copy copilot message ≠ Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) = Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) - however: = ≠ - how could Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) ? absolute wrong. - it should be like: Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) by design. 2. Copy improperly: if one copies `in-line code block` through ctrl+c (rather than the "copy button" provided alongside), it is very likely (coupled with double click) to paste it into " ￼ ". 3. Feature: Hopefully, the `in-line code block` can be partially copied (rather than merely allowing all copies) like the inter-line code block to improve efficiency. common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service fails to open due to version incompatibility
common_issues.description: Users are unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service. The error message "Instance of 'fp'" appears.  A common cause is the Pieces OS version being older than the minimum supported version (11.2.2). Updating to the latest Pieces OS version is recommended. On Windows, launching the application redirects to Pieces support, possibly due to an early access program issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch and data recovery issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems launching Pieces OS, with some instances redirecting to support.  Data recovery failures are also reported. Issues appear on Windows and macOS, potentially related to the Early Access Program and version compatibility between Pieces OS and the operating system.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving bugs related to Pieces OS and its plugins, especially on Windows, focusing on file-dragging, file-choosing window behavior, filter rule limitations, automatic redirection to support, and LLM upgrade failures.
Investigate and resolve the issues with Pieces Pro upgrade checkout process and connectivity problems between Pieces OS and browser extensions, particularly for users using VPNs.
Address the reported bugs in Pieces OS 12.1.1 related to copying code blocks (inline and inter-line), file dragging, and LLM upgrades not reflecting for Pro users.
Fix the Pieces Copilot Service launch issues, focusing on version incompatibility errors and automatic redirection to support on Windows.
Investigate and resolve the data recovery failures reported by users on Windows and macOS, potentially related to Early Access Program and OS compatibility issues.
Improve communication with users regarding minimum supported Pieces OS versions and provide clear guidance on updating to avoid compatibility problems.
Consider adding a feature to allow partial copying of inline code blocks for improved user experience.
